title: Project-Based Mathematics Education for Machine Learning-Driven TADF Molecular Development (K-12)

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary statistics, matrix operations, and comprehension of basic chemistry concepts
context.additional_context: Pre-service teachers conduct a project combining mathematical modeling and experimental data analysis to understand the OLED material development process.

learning_goals: Cultivating data analysis skills using mathematical models (matrices, probability) required for TADF molecular design.
Verifying the correlation between machine learning predictions and experimental data (e.g., PL spectroscopy) through mathematical methods.

Learners can collaborate in small groups of 3â€“4 to solve two molecular property optimization problems (e.g., molecular structure stability simulation) using Python-based numerical modeling tools (e.g., Jupyter Notebook) and complete group project reports and presentation materials. They must achieve an "excellent" rating in at least three out of five teacher evaluation criteria (problem definition, modeling accuracy, collaboration efficiency).

resources: TADF (Thermally Activated Delayed Fluorescence) Molecule Database (Text Summary)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
